revision.text:
'''Africa Fighting Malaria''' ('''AFM''') is an [[NGO]] based in [[Washington D.C.]], [[United States]] and [[South Africa]] which states it "seeks to educate people about the scourge of [[Malaria]] and the political economy of malaria control". The organization generally "promotes market based solutions and economic freedom as the best ways to ensure improved welfare and longer life expectancy in poor countries", according to their financial statement.<ref name="aidforafrica">{{cite web|url=http://www.aidforafrica.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/AFM-09-Audit-Report-only-1.pdf |title=Financial Statements for Years End December 31, 2009 and 2008 |publisher=aidforafrica.org |accessdate=2016-05-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303185247/http://www.aidforafrica.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/AFM-09-Audit-Report-only-1.pdf |archivedate=March 3, 2016 }}</ref> Founded in 2000 during the Stockholm Negotiations on Persistent Organic Pollutants, AFM's original focus was the promotion of a public health exemption for the insecticide DDT for malaria control. According to their current website, their mission is to "make malaria control more transparent, responsive and effective by holding public institutions accountable for funding and implementing effective, integrated and country-driven malaria control policies."
According to IRS filings, the organization spends money entirely on executive compensation, with no program expenses of any kind.<ref name="propublica">{{cite web|url=https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/300162292|title=Nonprofit Explorer - AFRICA FIGHTING MALARIA INTERNATIONAL INC - ProPublica|publisher=projects.propublica.org|accessdate=2016-05-16}}</ref> It has been described as a [[front group]] established to discredit environmentalists.<ref name="propublica"/><ref name="fair">{{cite web|url=http://fair.org/extra-online-articles/Rachel-Carson,-Mass-Murderer/ |title=Rachel Carson, Mass Murderer? | FAIR |publisher=fair.org |accessdate=2016-05-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160114041009/http://fair.org/extra-online-articles/Rachel-Carson%2C-Mass-Murderer/ |archivedate=2016-01-14 }}</ref> In documents obtained during [[Tobacco Master Settlement Agreement|state litigation against tobacco companies]], founder Roger Bate described the organization's purpose as part of a larger strategy to portray first-world environmentalists as unconcerned with Black Africans.<ref name="ucsf">{{cite web|url=http://legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/xvp83c00|title=Industry Documents Library|publisher=legacy.library.ucsf.edu|accessdate=2016-05-16}}</ref><ref name="ucsf2">{{cite web|url=http://legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/zvp83c00|title=Industry Documents Library|publisher=legacy.library.ucsf.edu|accessdate=2016-05-16}}</ref>
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.fightingmalaria.org Official website]
{{malaria}}
[[Category:Malaria organizations]] [[Category:Health campaigns]] [[Category:Medical and health organizations based in Washington, D.C.]]

{{pp-pc1}} {{Infobox Organization |name = |image = Alcohol_Justice_Logo_-_trademarked_with_tag_line.jpg |image_border = |size = |caption = |map = |msize = |mcaption = |abbreviation = AJ |motto = The Industry Watchdog |formation = 1987 |extinction = |type = Non-profit [[501(c)(3)]] |status = |purpose = [[Public Health]] advocacy and policy |headquarters = |location = [[San Rafael, CA]] |region_served = [[United States]] |membership = |language = |leader_title = Exec. Dir/CEO |leader_name = Bruce Lee Livingston |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |num_staff = 10 |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://alcoholjustice.org/ Alcohol Justice site] |remarks = }}
'''Alcohol Justice''' is a San Rafael, California-based non-profit advocacy, research and policy organization describing itself as "the [[industry]] [[Consumer organization|watchdog]]." '''The Marin Institute''' was renamed and re-branded as '''Alcohol Justice''' in 2011; it was originally named '''The Marin Institute for the Prevention of Alcohol and Other Drug Problems'''.<ref>[https://www.alcoholjustice.org/about/who-we-are Alcohol Justice: About Us]</ref>
In 2006, Alcohol Justice shifted its focus to the practices of alcohol corporations who produce, distribute, retail and advertise alcoholic beverages. Until 2006, Alcohol Justice focused strictly on alcohol harms and environmental prevention strategies. These strategies included reducing the hours during which time alcohol can be sold, increasing the size of warning labels on alcoholic beverage containers, requiring warnings on all alcohol advertisements, restricting the content and placement of alcohol ads, and prohibiting alcohol sponsorship of athletic events.
==History== Alcohol Justice was established in 1987 as one of three major projects funded by the Leonard and Beryl H. Buck Trust at the same time the Marin Community Foundation was formed. The Marin Institute reported in 2006 that "countering the alcohol industry has always been a high priority for the Marin Institute, but we now want to make it the central focus of our efforts. That means we'll put 100% of our energy into stopping the alcohol industry from harming [[public health]]."{{citation needed|date=June 2013}} In July 2011, the Marin Institute changed its name to Alcohol Justice to better align the organization's name with the national reach of its network.<ref name=marinij>J. Bernstein-Wax ''"[http://www.marinij.com/marinnews/ci_18712045 San Rafael's Alcohol Justice, formerly the Marin Institute, still fighting after 24 years]"'' Marin Independent Journal, August 21st, 2011</ref>
==Campaigns and programs== Alcohol Justice, although based in San Rafael, California, plays a research and advocacy role in other cities and counties of California, such as Los Angeles and San Francisco, and has led numerous campaigns for legislation and regulatory reform in Sacramento, California. Nonetheless, it is a national organization that has conducted national and international research projects, conducted hundreds of trainings of youth, community leaders and public health advocates throughout the United States, and participated in international activities as well in Canada, Europe, Africa and Thailand.
===Alcohol taxes and fees: Charge for Harm===
The Marin Institute participated in a flurry of alcohol tax increase campaigns in the early 1990s, which resulted in small increases in beer excise taxes in California at the U.S. federal level in 1991 and 1992. From December 2006 to November 2010, The Marin Institute convened and organized a California coalition to promote proposals for nickel or dime a drink excise taxes or mitigation fees, including [http://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billTextClient.xhtml?bill_id=200920100AB1019&search_keywords=alcohol/ AB 1019] (Assm. [[Jim Beall (California politician)|Jim Beall]], Dem-Santa Clara) supported in a testimonial video by [[Johnny Whitaker|John O. Whitaker, Jr.]]<ref>"Charge for harm testimonial," by John O. Whitaker, Jr., October 2009</ref>
The Charge for Harm campaign supported various bills in Sacramento and the San Francisco "Alcohol Cost Recovery Fee" ultimately vetoed by PlumpJack wine-distributorship owning Mayor [[Gavin Newsom]] in September 2010.<ref>"Advocates Rally in San Francisco to Support a Charge for Harm Alcohol Mitigation Fee," PRNewswire/Sys-Con Media, August 2, 2010, http://www.sys-con.com/node/1484758</ref><ref>"City Hall clash brews over booze fee," Wall Street Journal,Cari Tuna, August 12, 2010</ref><ref>S.F. Mayor Newsom vetoes fee on alcohol, John Coté,San Francisco Chronicle/SFGate.com, September 22, 2010. http://www.sfgate.com/politics/article/S-F-Mayor-Newsom-vetoes-fee-on-alcohol-3173753.php#ixzz24hA3vNqr</ref><ref>S.F. Mayor Newsom vetoes fee on alcohol, John Coté,San Francisco Chronicle/SFGate.com, September 22, 2010. http://www.sfgate.com/politics/article/S-F-Mayor-Newsom-vetoes-fee-on-alcohol-3173753.php#ixzz24hA3vNqr</ref> (More info at San Francisco Alcohol Cost Recovery database.)
Ultimately the California campaign ground to a halt in November 2010 with the passage of Proposition 26 with 51.4% of the vote, supported by the Wine Institute, the California Chamber of Commerce, Chevron, and collectively oil, tobacco, and alcohol corporations. Proposition 26 now requires in California a 2/3 vote of both legislative houses to pass impact or mitigation fees to charge industries for the harm caused by production or consumption, and requires a 2/3 vote of the electorate to pass such fees at the municipal or county level.<ref>"California Proposition 26, Supermajority Vote to Pass New Taxes and Fees (2010)", http://ballotpedia.org/wiki/index.php/California_Proposition_26,_Supermajority_Vote_to_Pass_New_Taxes_and_Fees_%282010%29</ref><ref> "Calif.'s Little-Noticed Prop 26 Squeaks Through in Dead of Night," by Colin Sullivan, New York Times, Nove. 3, 2010. https://www.nytimes.com/gwire/2010/11/03/03greenwire-califs-little-noticed-prop-26-squeaks-through-59912.html</ref>
===Stop Alcopops=== Alcohol Justice argues that [[alcopops]] should be regulated because they appeal to youth, who might not like other alcoholic beverages. When caffeinated alcoholic beverages, commonly containing 12% ABV and packaged in 24-oz cans, went off the market, the manufacturers of these beverages reformulated the beverages so as to be without caffeine. Alcohol Justice especially argues against the reformulated products partly due to the fact that the alcohol content has not changed.<ref>"Alcohol Justice: Stop Alcopops",http://www.alcoholjustice.org/campaigns/stop-alcopops.html {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121208053611/http://www.alcoholjustice.org/campaigns/stop-alcopops.html |date=2012-12-08 }}</ref> Alcohol Justice is currently lobbying for legislation to limit the size and alcohol concentration of alcopops.<ref>"Model Statute by Marin Institute", http://www.alcoholjustice.org/images/stories/FINALModelSuperSized-2.pdf</ref>
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.alcoholjustice.org/ Alcohol Justice home page]

{{Infobox soap character | series = Hollyoaks | name = Ally Gorman | portrayer = [[Daniel O'Connor (singer)|Daniel O'Connor]] | image = Ally Gorman.jpg | imagesize = 200px | introducer = [[Emma Smithwick]] | first = 31 January 2012 | last = 27 November 2012 | classification = [[List of past Hollyoaks characters#Last appeared in 2012|Former; regular]] | occupation = Military medic | home = }} '''<!--Alistair was never this character's name, so please do not add it-->Ally Gorman''' (also '''Edward James'''<ref name="LMorgan"/>) is a [[Character (arts)|fictional character]] from the [[Channel 4]] [[soap opera]] ''[[Hollyoaks]]'', played by [[Daniel O'Connor (singer)|Daniel O'Connor]]. The actor's casting was announced in December 2011. O'Connor originally auditioned for a different role, before being asked to audition for the part of Ally. O'Connor was given the part and began filming his scenes three days later. ''Hollyoaks''{{'}} series producer, [[Emma Smithwick]], said that O'Connor "nailed" his audition. O'Connor signed up for an initial twelve episode stint, but his contract was extended and he became a regular cast member. The actor commutes from London to Liverpool for filming. O'Connor made his debut screen appearance as Ally during the episode broadcast on 31 January 2012. O'Connor departed ''Hollyoaks'' on 27 November 2012.
Before his arrival on screen, O'Connor revealed that Ally has a "dark past" that would be "uncovered eventually in true soap style". Ally is Australian and a military medic. O'Connor described his character as a "nice, loveable guy" who is "very friendly and kind". Smithwick said Ally is "contradictory" and "crosses a divide". She called Ally sensitive and described him as a "real guy's guy". A writer for the official ''Hollyoaks'' website described Ally as a "Hot Aussie" In June 2012, it was revealed that Ally would lose his "strait-laced good boy" reputation.
Ally is introduced as the new lodger of [[Jacqui McQueen]] ([[Claire Cooper]]) and [[Rhys Ashworth]] ([[Andrew Moss]]). Ally's storylines have mainly focused on his relationship with [[Amy Barnes]] ([[Ashley Slanina-Davies]]). It is later revealed that Ally has a "mystery connection" to newcomer, [[Walker (Hollyoaks)|Walker]] ([[Neil Newbon]]). [[Lynsey Nolan]] ([[Karen Hassan]]) discovers this and decides to investigate their past history. Lynsey is later murdered in a [[whodunit]] storyline, with Ally becoming a suspect in her death. Sarah Ellis of ''Inside Soap'' did not agree with a viewers criticism of O'Connor's acting and opined that he is doing a "stellar job".
==Casting== On 11 December 2011, Jonathon Moran and Elle Halliwell of ''[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]'' reported that O'Connor had joined the cast of ''Hollyoaks'' as Ally.<ref name="cast">{{cite web|last=Moran|first=Jonathon|title=Old neighbour Dan O'Connor is in Hollyoaks|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/old-neighbour-dan-oconnor-is-in-hollyoaks/story-e6frewyr-1226218949064|work=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]|publisher=([[News Limited]])|accessdate=4 August 2012|author2=Halliwell, Elle|date=11 December 2011}}</ref> O'Connor was previously best known for playing [[Ned Parker]] in Australian soap opera, ''[[Neighbours]]''.<ref name="cast"/> O'Connor originally auditioned for a different role twice, before being asked to audition for the part of Ally.<ref name="oconnords">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' Dan O'Connor reveals Ally role details: Interview|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/interviews/a362060/hollyoaks-dan-oconnor-reveals-ally-role-details-interview.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=25 January 2012|accessdate=4 August 2012}}</ref> O'Connor was given the part and began filming his scenes three days later.<ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor said of his casting: "I'm really excited about joining ''Hollyoaks'', especially with its recent success. [...] I'm really looking forward to working with some of the show's most popular characters and talented actors."<ref name="war">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' newcomer Ally to spark love war |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a355627/hollyoaks-newcomer-ally-to-spark-love-war.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=12 December 2011|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> ''Hollyoaks''{{'}} series producer, [[Emma Smithwick]], told Sarah Ellis of ''[[Inside Soap]]'' that she was familiar with O'Connor from his work on ''Neighbours''.<ref name=emma>{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|title=Secrets of Hollyoaks|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=7–13 January 2012|series=40-41|issue=1|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]}}</ref> Smithwick said that when O'Connor auditioned for the role he "nailed it" and admitted that the actor's good looks were also appealing.<ref name=emma/> O'Connor signed up for an initial twelve episode stint, but his contract was extended and he became a regular cast member.<ref name=dan>{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|title=Joining Hollyoaks is like going to a new school!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=28 January – 3 February 2012|series=40-41|issue=4|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]}}</ref> O'Connor commutes from London to Liverpool, where ''Hollyoaks'' is filmed, for the role.<ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor made his first screen appearance as Ally on 31 January 2012.<ref name="first">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=Corrie trial shocks, 'Enders dancing, E'dale warning, 'Oaks newcomer |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s3/coronation-street/scoop/a361387/corrie-trial-shocks-enders-dancing-edale-warning-oaks-newcomer.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=22 January 2012|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref><ref name="romance"/> In April 2012, O'Connor revealed that he would remain on the show "at least until the end of [2012]".<ref name="whatsontv"/> The character was originally named "Ally Grogan",<ref name=dan/> which was later changed to "Ally Gorman".<ref name="official">{{cite web|title=Ally Gorman (played by Dan O'Connor)|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/cast/boys/allygorman.html|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]]|publisher=([[Channel Four Television Corporation]])|accessdate=9 August 2012}}</ref> On 20 October 2012 the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' reported that O'Connor had left the serial and had already filmed his final scenes.<ref>{{cite web|last=Dadds|first=Kimberly|title=So it was a short and chic dress code then: Jorgie Porter leads the way at Hollyoaks party as the girls nearly all wear minuscule dresses|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2220584/Jorgie-Porter-leads-way-Hollyoaks-party-nearly-wear-minuscule-dresses.html|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=([[Associated Newspapers]])|date=20 October 2012|accessdate=22 October 2012}}</ref>
==Development==
===Characterisation and introduction=== Ally is Australian and a military medic, who has recently returned from service in Afghanistan.<ref name="cast"/><ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor revealed that Ally has a "dark past" that would be "uncovered eventually in true soap style".<ref name="oconnords"/> When asked to describe his character in an interview with Daniel Kilkelly of [[Digital Spy]], O'Connor stated "He's a nice, loveable guy - very friendly and kind."<ref name="oconnords"/> The official ''Hollyoaks'' website described Ally as a "Hot Aussie".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/cast/boys/allygrogan.html|title=Ally Gorman (played by Dan O'Connor)|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]]|publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]])|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> Smithwick said she liked Ally because he is "contradictory" and "crosses a divide", calling him "sensitive".<ref name=emma/> Smithwick described Ally as a "real guy's guy".<ref name=emma/> Ally arrives in the village as a lodger for [[Jacqui McQueen]] ([[Claire Cooper]]) and [[Rhys Ashworth]] ([[Andrew Moss]]).<ref name="war"/> Both Jacqui and Rhys like Ally.<ref name="oconnords"/> Smithwick revealed that Ally would befriend Rhys and they would become "buddies".<ref name=emma/> O'Connor told Kilkelly that there is a "good bond" between Ally and Rhys.<ref name="oconnords"/> The actor revealed that Ally and Rhys "seem to get on really well".<ref name="oconnords"/> It initially appears that the living arrangements are "quite rosy and like a perfect match".<ref name="oconnords"/> However, as Ally stays longer he questions whether he was right to move in with Jacqui and Rhys as they are continuously arguing.<ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor noted the similarities between Ally and Ned Parker, the character he portrayed in Australian soap opera, ''Neighbours''.<ref name="oconnords"/> He told Kilkelly "At first, it felt like I was playing the same character that I played on ''Neighbours'', but that could just be a stereotypical Australian thing - that we all seem to be laid-back, genuine people!"<ref name="oconnords"/>
===Relationship with Amy Barnes=== [[File:Ashley Slanina-Davies.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Ashley Slanina-Davies (''pictured'') plays Ally's love interest, Amy Barnes.]] O'Connor told a writer from ''[[All About Soap]]'' that there is "definitely potential" for a romance to develop between Ally and another character.<ref name="romance">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' Dan O'Connor expects Ally romance|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a360804/hollyoaks-dan-oconnor-expects-ally-romance.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=18 January 2012|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> O'Connor was not permitted to reveal the character's identity.<ref name="romance"/> [[Ste Hay]] ([[Kieron Richardson]]) and [[Amy Barnes]] ([[Ashley Slanina-Davies]]) "take an instant fancy" to Ally, who is not aware of their interest in him.<ref name="romance"/> O'Connor explained "The whole thing is pretty innocent to start off with, but it quickly gets more complicated when Ste and Amy make it their mission to find out whether Ally is gay or straight."<ref name="romance"/> On-screen there is mystery surrounding Ally's sexuality and Ste and Amy are "both being ultra nice and saying suggestive things to him".<ref name="romance"/> O'Connor stated that he knows Ally's sexuality, but ''Hollyoaks'' producers told him to keep it a secret.<ref name="romance"/> Richardson revealed that he was "very heavily involved" in Ally's introduction to the show.<ref name="richardsonds">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' star Kieron Richardson teases Ste's future: Interview |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/interviews/a357717/hollyoaks-star-kieron-richardson-teases-stes-future-interview.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=30 December 2011|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> O'Connor told Kilkelly that Ally would become attracted to either Ste or Amy.<ref name="oconnords"/> Ally is revealed to be heterosexual,<ref name="changes">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' Dan O'Connor promises big Ally changes|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a385551/hollyoaks-dan-oconnor-promises-big-ally-changes.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=6 June 2012|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> and he asks Amy out on a date before he returns to the army.<ref name="whatsontv">{{cite web|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/soaps/hollyoaks/interviews/hollyoaks-dan-its-truth-time-for-ally/16028|title=Hollyoaks' Dan: 'It's truth time for Ally!'|date=10 April 2012|work=[[What's on TV]]|publisher=[[IPC Media]]|accessdate=5 August 2012}}</ref> In April 2012, Susan Hill of the ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' reported that Ally would begin a relationship with Amy.<ref name="eye">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/posts/view/245954|title=Hollyoaks: Ally Grogan has his eye on Amy Barnes|last=Hill|first=Susan|date=15 April 2012|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=[[Northern & Shell]]|accessdate=6 August 2012}}</ref> O'Connor told a writer from ''[[Soaplife]]'' "They had a couple of dates and they're now in the thick of a relationship."<ref name="whatsontv"/> The actor added that Ally is "besotted" with Amy.<ref name="whatsontv"/>
Ally is "not bothered" that Amy and Ste have two children, [[Leah Barnes]] (Elá-May Melek Demircan) and [[Lucas Hay]] (Reuben Thwaites), together as he "likes kids".<ref name="whatsontv"/> O'Connor told a writer from ''Soaplife'' that Ste does not want Ally to be a father figure to the Leah and Lucas.<ref name="whatsontv"/> O'Connor said "I think Ste's feeling protective."<ref name="whatsontv"/> Ste interrupts Ally and Amy whilst they are on a date and asks Ally what his intentions towards Amy are.<ref name="meaty">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' Dan O'Connor: 'Meaty story ahead for Ally'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a375732/hollyoaks-dan-oconnor-meaty-story-ahead-for-ally.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=10 April 2012|accessdate=7 August 2012}}</ref> Of this, O'Connor commented "Ally's a bit frustrated, but he understands why Ste feels he needs to look after Amy."<ref name="meaty"/> Ally tells Ste he wants a "committed relationship" with Amy and that he "fell for her" the first time they met.<ref name="whatsontv"/>
In May 2012, Amy tells Ally that their relationship is progressing too fast, leaving him "heartbroken".<ref name="rival">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/posts/view/249679/Hollyoaks-Ally-Grogan-attacks-his-love-rival-|title=Hollyoaks: Ally Grogan attacks his love rival|last=Hill|first=Susan|date=6 May 2012|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=[[Northern & Shell]]|accessdate=7 August 2012}}</ref> Amy then has a one-night stand with [[Dodger (Hollyoaks)|Dodger]] ([[Danny Mac]]).<ref name="rival"/> Ally returns to see Amy the next day and hopes they can reconcile.<ref name="rival"/> He is unaware of her fling with Dodger, who hides on Ally's arrival.<ref name="rival"/> Amy refuses to reconcile to get Ally out of the flat.<ref name="rival"/> Amy goes on a road trip to forget about her problems, but is unaware that Dodger's cousin, [[Dennis Savage]] ([[Joe Tracini]]), has invited both Dodger and Ally on the trip.<ref name="rival"/> A ''Hollyoaks'' insider explained "Dennis has no idea that Dodger has slept with Amy when he decides to help Ally get back with her. He’s really pleased with his match-making skills but as you can imagine Amy is mortified."<ref name="rival"/> They revealed that Amy feels "terrible" for the one-night stand, which Ally would discover.<ref name="rival"/> The insider added that "Ally feels like a total idiot" and attacks Dodger.<ref name="rival"/>
===Secret=== When the character of Ally was announced, it was revealed that he has a "dark past" that would be "uncovered eventually in true soap style".<ref name="cast"/> In January 2012, O'Connor admitted that he did not know Ally's secret and that the storyline was still being developed.<ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor said "I've been told that [the secret is] a good one" and added that it would probably shock people.<ref name="oconnords"/> The actor opined that the secret would cause conflict between Ally and other character's.<ref name="oconnords"/> O'Connor later commented that the secret would produce a "very big, meaty storyline".<ref name="whatsontv"/> In June 2012, it was reported that [[Lynsey Nolan]] ([[Karen Hassan]]) would discover that there may be a "mystery connection" between Ally and newcomer, [[Walker (Hollyoaks)|Walker]] ([[Neil Newbon]]).<ref name="plot">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' Neil Newbon: 'Walker plot is so exciting'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a385157/hollyoaks-neil-newbon-walker-plot-is-so-exciting.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=3 June 2012|accessdate=7 August 2012}}</ref> Lynsey sees Walker threatening Ally to keep quiet about their past and decides to investigate them.<ref name="changes"/> O'Connor told [[Matthew Wright (television presenter)|Matthew Wright]] of ''[[The Wright Stuff]]'' that Ally would lose his "strait-laced good boy" reputation.<ref name="changes"/>
During the episode broadcast on 29 June 2012, Lynsey is found dead by [[Brendan Brady]] ([[Emmett J. Scanlan]]).<ref name="lynsey">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' airs shock death in E4 first look episode |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a390489/hollyoaks-airs-shock-death-in-e4-first-look-episode.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=28 June 2012|accessdate=8 August 2012}}</ref> The death sparked a [[whodunnit]] storyline, with Ally in the frame for Lynsey's murder.<ref name="mystery">{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' teases Lynsey Nolan mystery - promo picture|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/scoop/a390720/hollyoaks-teases-lynsey-nolan-mystery-promo-picture.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|date=29 June 2012|accessdate=8 August 2012}}</ref> Digital Spy explained Ally's motives stating, "Additionally, [Ally] and bad boy [Walker] had both found themselves struggling to keep their secrets from an inquisitive Lynsey in recent episodes - providing them with a reason to target her."<ref name="lynsey"/> A promotional image featuring Ally was later released by ''Hollyoaks'' which confirmed Ally as an official suspect in the mystery.<ref name="mystery"/>
===The Kane family=== In October 2012, Digital Spy's Kilkelly reported that ''Hollyoaks'' had planned scenes involving Ally and [[Lacey Kane]] (Georgia Bourke) growing close.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='Hollyoaks' lines up Ally, Lacey spark? - spoiler pictures|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/scoop/a422868/hollyoaks-lines-up-ally-lacey-spark-spoiler-pictures.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=15 October 2012|date=9 October 2012}}</ref> O'Connor told a writer from ''Inside Soap'' that Ally feels "put out" by Martha's return. She is "out to expose Ally" at a time he was beginning to become liked by the Kanes.<ref name=lace/> Lacey develops a crush on Ally after she steals Ash's credit card and he covers for her. The duo fall to the ground and stare at each other during a game of football. The actor explained that "there's a split second where there is something" between them. Ally gains control over the Kane household because of his encounter with Lacey. O'Connor concluded that Ally has a "hero complex" and "goes about everything the wrong way".<ref name=lace>{{cite journal|title=Ally's game plan|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=13–19 October 2012|issue=41|pages=28|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]}}</ref>
==Storylines== Jacqui McQueen and Rhys Ashworth advertise for a lodger, and Ally replies to the advertisement. Jacqui and Rhys interview Ally and subsequently allow him to move in. Ally meets his neighbours, Ste Hay and Amy Barnes, and invites them over for a dinner party. Ally is unimpressed when Jacqui and Amy become drunk and ruin the party. Ally considers moving out when Jacqui and Rhys continuously argue. Ally kisses [[Mercedes McQueen]] ([[Jennifer Metcalfe]]) and asks her out on a date, but she declines. Ally goes on the date with Mercedes' sister, [[Michaela McQueen]] ([[Hollie-Jay Bowes]]), instead. Ally becomes annoyed when Michaela and Amy argue as they are both attracted to him. Ally tells Michaela and Amy that he does not want to date either of them. Jacqui and Rhys' new lodger, [[Phoebe McQueen|Phoebe Jackson]] (Mandip Gill), steals Ally's laptop and Jacqui refuses to report Phoebe to the police. Jacqui and Rhys pay Ally the amount the laptop was worth and he moves out. Ally asks Amy out on a date before returning to the army.
Ally returns; he and Amy begin a relationship. Ally hopes to spend time alone with Amy, but Ste interrupts them and questions Ally's intentions towards Amy. Amy tells Ally that their relationship is moving to fast and he leaves for the night. The next day, Ally attempts to reunite with Amy, unaware that she has had a one-night stand with Dodger. Amy refuses, and goes on a road trip to forget about her problems. Amy is unaware that Dodger's cousin, [[Dennis Savage]] ([[Joe Tracini]]), has invited both Dodger and Ally on the trip. Dennis hopes to reconcile Ally and Amy. Ally learns that Amy and Dodger had sex, and attacks Dodger. Ally refuses to forgive Amy and returns to the village. Ally and Amy later reunite.
Ally sees Walker and recognises him as "Nick" from the army. Walker tells Ally he is mistaken. Walker threatens Ally not to reveal their past history to anyone, which Lynsey Nolan witnesses. Lynsey decides to investigate Ally and follows him to a strip club. Lynsey confronts Ally and they argue when she threatens to tell Amy. Ste overhears them arguing and decides to tell Amy. Lynsey is later found dead. Ste tells Amy about Ally and Lynsey's argument. Ally and Lynsey's argument was witnessed and the police question Ally about Lynsey's death. Amy provides an alibi for Ally, telling the police that they were together at the time Lynsey was murdered. Ally tells Amy he was at a strip club when Lynsey was murdered. Ally explains that he visits strip clubs to look out for the strippers, as his sister was a stripper and was raped by two customers. A stripper at the club verifies Ally's story to Amy and Ste. Amy tells Ally she cannot trust him and leaves. Ally then pays the stripper for covering for him. When [[Will Savage]] (James Atherton) is accused of being Lynsey's murderer, Ally leads a hate campaign against him. Ally befriends [[Ash Kane]] ([[Holly Weston]]) and they both help prove Will's innocence. Ally and Ash later share a kiss. Ally tells Amy about the kiss, explaining that he suffers from Post traumatic stress disorder and was having a panic attack when the kiss happened. Ally then ends his relationship with Amy and moves out. Ash allows Ally to stay with her. He then later sustains a relationship with Ash, and this angers Amy- so soon after they separated.
==Reception== ''Inside Soap's'' Sarah Ellis did not agree with a viewer's criticism of O'Connor's acting, commenting that the actor had been doing a "stellar job" of portraying Ally.<ref name="box">{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|title=Soap Box|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=11–17 February 2012|issue=6|pages=97|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]}}</ref> Anthony D. Langford writing for [[AfterEllen.com and AfterElton.com#AfterElton.com|AfterElton]] stated "I see the show is trying to make Ally interesting by tying him into Brendan and Walker's storyline. But the character is so dull and so underwritten I don't see how it can help."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afterelton.com/tv/langford-on-soaps-06-27-2012?page=1,2|title=Langford On Soaps: Will Scott Pay for What He Did to Macs on "People of the Valley"?|last=Langford|first=Anthony D.|date=27 June 2012|work=[[AfterEllen.com and AfterElton.com#AfterElton.com|AfterElton]]|publisher=[[Logo (TV channel)|Logo]]|accessdate=11 August 2012}}</ref> A reporter for the ''[[Liverpool Echo]]'' said "Ever since smooth-talking Ally strolled into Hollyoaks village, the suave Aussie has managed to charm his way into most of the locals' good books - but what do they really know about him? Very little, it would appear..."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-302441900.html|title=Soap suds|date=15 September 2012|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|publisher=~([[Trinity Mirror]] via [[Highbeam Research]])|accessdate=25 September 2012}}{{subscription required}}</ref> Carena Crawford from ''Reveal'' branded the character as a "shady Australian".<ref>{{cite web|last=Crawford|first=Carena|title=Corrie, Emmerdale, Hollyoaks: Wednesday's soap highlights|url=http://www.reveal.co.uk/lifestyle/news/a406040/corrie-emmerdale-hollyoaks-wednesdays-soap-highlights.html|work=Reveal|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=14 October 2012|date=19 September 2012}}</ref> Laura Morgan from ''All About Soap'' questioned the point of the character following his departure, saying "Considering we'd waited the best part of a year to discover this news, we were left a bit cold by Ally's big reveal. For a character that had a lot more potential, he was given a hurried and anti-climatic exit. In fact, Ash kneeing him in the nuts might have been the most exciting thing about the whole thing!"<ref name="LMorgan">{{cite web|url=http://www.allaboutsoap.co.uk/blog/hollyoaks-what-was-the-point-of-ally/|title=Hollyoaks: What was the point of Ally?|last=Morgan|first=Laura|date=27 November 2012|work=[[All About Soap]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|accessdate=27 November 2012}}</ref>
==See also== *[[List of Hollyoaks characters (2012)]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/cast/boys/allygorman.html Ally Gorman] at [[E4 (channel)|E4.com]]

revision.text:
The '''Anlene Orchard Mile''' is a sporting event exclusive to women held in [[Singapore]] where women either run or walk a mile (1.6 kilometres) on a straight course down Singapore’s most famous and popular shopping street, [[Orchard Road]]. Just for the event, traffic authorities close off two lanes of one of Singapore’s busiest streets for the duration of the race that is usually held in the morning from 7am onwards. The flag-off for the mile begins near the [[Dhoby Ghaut MRT Station]] and ends near [[Orchard MRT Station]] where participants run past famous landmarks such as the [[Istana]], the President’s place of residence.
==History==
The Anlene Orchard Mile was first launched in Singapore in 2007 and was sponsored by Anlene, a dairy nutrition corporation. The aim is to highlight the risk of [[osteoporosis]] and raise bone health awareness about building strong bones from within through a sufficient calcium intake of milk everyday coupled with [[weight bearing]] exercises as well as to foster the growth and recognition of women in sports in Singapore. The inaugural event in 2007 saw over 2,000 female participants taking part with local TV and radio celebrities lending their name to the cause. Although Anlene Orchard Mile is a running event, participants can walk the race according to their own fitness level. For 2007 and 2008, the official beneficiary of the Anlene Orchard Mile has been the Osteoporosis Society of Singapore (the local chapter of the International Osteoporosis Foundation), where a portion of the proceeds goes to the society. The Anlene Orchard Mile is modelled against successful mile events around the world including the prestigious [[Fifth Avenue Mile]] in [[New York City|New York]] and the [[Sport_Relief#Sport_Relief_Mile|Sport Relief Mile]] which attracts over 10,000 runners and walkers to 15 events across [[England]].
==Entrants==
The Anlene Orchard Mile comprises three categories – the ''Elite Mile'', the ''Women’s Mile'' and the ''Corporate Mile''. The ''Elite Mile'' is an invitational category with a cash prize that is open to competitive runners where past race records are compulsory for verification before an invitation is extended for participation by the organisers. The Anlene Orchard Mile 2007 Elite category winner was Suzy Walsham, a two-time winner of the [[Empire_State_Building#Empire_State_Building_Run-Up|U.S. Empire State Building Run-up]], who walked away with a cash prize of SGD10,500.
The ''Women’s Mile'' is a category open to women of all ages and fitness levels. The ''Corporate Mile'' is targeted at corporations where female employees are encouraged to participate in groups of four or more.
==References== *{{cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/281416/1/.html|title=Hip fractures up five times in Singapore since 1960s|last=Nie|first=Hoe Yeen|date=2007-07-10|work=Channel NewsAsia|publisher=MediaCorp Pte Ltd|accessdate=2008-05-16}} *{{cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/266977/1/.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20080514171422/http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/266977/1/.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-05-14|title=Orchard Rd to be closed for Anlene Orchard Mile involving 5,000 runners|last=Singh|first=Patwant|date=2007-03-28|work=Channel NewsAsia|publisher=MediaCorp Pte Ltd|accessdate=2008-05-16}} *{{cite news|url=http://www.pando.com.au/sponsorshipnews/releases/release/35778.html |title=Anlene Orchard Mile in Sunny Singapore |date=2007-06-12 |publisher=Sponsorship News Pty Ltd |accessdate=2008-05-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080724121653/http://www.pando.com.au/sponsorshipnews/releases/release/35778.html |archivedate=2008-07-24 }}
==External links==
[[Category:Health-related fundraisers]] [[Category:Mile races]]
